item.summary: UpdateStatisticsTest fails after we enabled the automatic calculation of index statistics.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I have been able to reproduce this problem on my Mac OS X laptop. At least, I can trigger one instance of the problem. The tinderbox tests show that the problem occurs there in both the embedded and network cases. A comment in the test says that the problem may occur in the network case and speculates that that may be the only place it occurs. In any event, I ran UpdateStatisticsTest 100 times and saw the problem in 20 of the test runs.

Attaching derby-5025-aa-disableAutoStatsCalc.diff. This is an attempt to fix this test bug. Committed at subversion revision 1069890.

According to a TODO comment in the test, we should disable the automatic calculation of statistics when this test is run. That's what this patch does. I have run the test for 100 iterations on my machine and not seen the problem. So I am reasonably hopeful that this fixes it.

Touches the following file:

M java/testing/org/apache/derbyTesting/functionTests/tests/lang/UpdateStatisticsTest.java

Thanks for fixing this, Rick.

I forgot to commit the patch attached to DERBY-4837. Adding a link to mark this issue as a duplicate of the issue above.
Closing issue, since I just closed the one this issue duplicates (DERBY-4837).
